p: Femur length showed a strong positive correlation with CRL (R 2 = 0.96) ( Fig 6A). Ossification in the femoral shaft was detected in all specimens with a CRL of ≥40 mm. Similarly, OSL showed a strong positive correlation with CRL (R 2 = 0.95) ( Fig 6A). The OSL-to-femur length ratio rapidly increased by approximately 50% in fetuses with CRL between 40 and 75 mm ( Fig 6B). The rate of increase became moderate in fetuses with a CRL of ≥75 mm, which reached to 70% in fetuses with a CRL of 185 mm.
